Event: Israel launches a military offensive in Gaza, aiming to eliminate Hamas after a deadly cross-border assault on Oct 7.
Fuel supplies run out at Al-Shifa hospital, resulting in the deaths of eight babies due to the lack of electricity to run incubator units.
Israel offers to evacuate babies from Al Shifa hospital after two newborns die due to fuel shortage.
Israeli military announces its willingness to help evacuate babies from Al Shifa hospital at the request of the hospital staff.
Israeli tanks and troops storm into Gaza and seize wide areas in the north and northwest.
Reports of a potential hostage deal emerge, with Israel expressing hope for the release of a significant number of hostages in the coming days.
Israeli military shares evidence of weapons and hostages being held in the basement of Rantissi Hospital, a children's hospital in Gaza.
The World Health Organization (WHO) describes Al-Shifa hospital as a “death zone” after sending a team to visit the facility.
Hundreds of people flee Al-Shifa hospitals, with the hospital director stating the evacuations occurred after Israeli army orders to empty the facility.
Al-Shifa hospital becomes a focal point for Israeli operations, with the army claiming Hamas uses it as a base. Hamas and medical staff deny the accusations.
Medics safely evacuate 31 premature babies from war-torn Al-Shifa hospital in Gaza City to a hospital in Rafah.
